page.title: 01RHYMNEY LANDSCAPE
page.content: The town of Rhymney takes its name from the river which rises in the moorlands of Powys and flows through the valley entering the sea at Cardiff. Rhymney,or Rhymni in Welsh, is divided into four distinct areas.These are: Blaen-Rhymni, Llechryd and Rhymney which are situated at the top edge of the town near the moorland and the Heads of the Valleys Road;Middle Rhymney an area of established commercial and residential buildings and finally Lower Rhymney, consisting of council housing and industry. Founded mainly as a result of its economic position in the late 18th and 19th centuries, it is a fairly typical example 0f a Welsh valley town with terraced houses, chapels and high rainfall.
